alert.note: Alert for Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Western Canyonlands (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Garfield and northern Kane Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 530 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles west of Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, or 31 miles east of Escalante, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Glen Canyon National Recreation Area. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Capitol Reef National Park and Vicinity; South Central Utah; Western Canyonlands
